feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: freight cost from sales order to delivery
entry.content:
Hello SAP Team,

My client has a requirement to notify the shipping department when a freight cost is added to a sales order.

This must be done by adding a value like 0,01 to the freight cost in the sales order. When the shipping department will see 0,01 in the outbound delivery, they will know that a freight cost must be added to the outbound delivery.

I know that the standard SAP does not support copying the value a freight cost to a delivery note but does anyone here have a solution? Or ever had a requirement like this before?

Thanks 

Thanks

entry.title: OUTB Delivery - Picking Request Doc do not confirm
entry.content:
Hi...

for some reason I can't figure out, I can't complete the Picking Request Document.

We have a system that creates a Sales Order and a Outb. Delivery. We have 2 scenarios...

1 - an Employee must pick the item itself and do the picking manually using the Pick Outbound Delivery app. This works fine..

2 - A customer pick an item directly from the shelf, so when the Sales Order + Outb. Dlvr are created, Picking and PGI should be automatically created.

Here's my issue on the second scenario... I'm not being able to complete the Picking Request Document, so the Picking Status is B, instead of C. [IMG 1]

And the Picking Request stays as "Open" [IMG 2]

I tried to use FM WS_DELIVERY_UPDATE, but I only get the error that the Piking Request is not completed. VL E 618.

If I try to pass the number of items in VBPOK_TAB, I get the error that the confirmed qty and the picked qty are different for the amount of the items..

I still can change the status to C if I manually do it on VL02N, but it does not call a BAPI or any other FM. [IMG 3]

any thoughts on how to make it work?

entry.title: aATP Product Substitution based on Material and Plant
entry.content:
Looking for expert comments on aATP Product Substitution in the SAP S/4HANA 2021 system:

1. Assume that each plant (Plant 1, Plant 2, etc.) has Product A as the original material and Product B as its substitute. 

2. Now aATP should first check Plant 1 for the availability of Product A. If not available, it should continue checking sequentially through Plant 2, Plant 3, Plant 4, and Plant 5, all for Product A.

3. If a partial quantity of Product A is available in Plant 1, aATP should consider that quantity to confirm and then check the remaining quantity in Plant 2, and so on. It should continue checking all plants until the full requirement is fulfilled with Product A.

4. If Product A is not available in any of the five plants, aATP should then consider Product B as the substitute, starting from the plant where the order was created. It should check Plant 1 for Product B, followed by Plant 2, Plant 3, Plant 4, and Plant 5, in the same sequence.

I know there is BAPI available in 2023 and possible, looking for the way out in case of S4HANA 2021.

Any suggest, please?

entry.title: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe Form (SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN) in SAP S/4HANA Publi
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition, 3-System Landscape) and using the standard billing form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN.

Currently, in the billing document PDF we are getting only the cumulative GST value. The business requirement is to show CGST, SGST, and IGST separately in the Adobe form.
       

  • How can we extend the standard form to bring in CGST, SGST, and IGST values?

  • Is there any standard way to fetch these fields or do we need backend logic to split cumulative GST into CGST/SGST/IGST?

  • Are there any blogs, KBAs, or SAP Help documents that explain how to extend SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN for India GST scenarios?

      If anyone has already implemented this, please suggest the correct approach or point me to a reference blog/document.

Thanks in advance,
Sanjay

Please help to identify the correct process and config steps

entry.title: S/4 - Open Sales Order Report with Partialy Deliveries
entry.content:
Hi, Everyone!.   I'm looking for guidance on how best to support a business requirement to have a sales open order report which takes into account partial deliveries.   List of Sales Orders does not have the ability to include delivery quantity so I'm leaning towards creating a custom analytical query, however, this is proving to be challenging as the available data cubes do not seem to contain the delivered quantity information.   Has anyone developed a similar report?   Does anyone have an advice on how to create the custom analytical query?   Appreciate your time!!  

SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Considerations on multiple Distribution Channels (and Divisions) in SD Org. Structure
entry.content:
Hi, this is a common topic when designing the SD org. structure - we usually try to limit the number of Distribution Channels and Divisions to avoid redundant maintenance of customer and material master data in the sales view.

However, let's assume a case where we need to create 5 distribution channels (Wholesale, Retail, Online, etc.), but we don‚Äôt want to maintain thousands of material master records/sales views separately for each channel, especially since there‚Äôs no difference from the material perspective. Still, materials should be available via all channels in sales docs.

On the other hand, we do need to maintain customer master data for a certain distribution channel - due to specific master data, sales document settings, reporting, authorizations, etc.

It seems that the "common distribution channel" functionality, for some reason, can‚Äôt be used here because it‚Äôs not possible to define a common channel for the material master only.
(Similarly, it would be great if we could define a common division for customer master data only, but again... it's not possible).

Do you have any ideas or real-life examples from your projects on how to handle such cases?

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply Chain in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (web-based Fiori apps, though standard TCodes like MMBE are still available).

Here‚Äôs the scenario:

  1. Using MMBE, suppose we have 10,000 stock available.

  2. Multiple salesmen are creating sales orders, deliveries, posting PGI, and invoices.

  3. Sometimes, one user leaves the process incomplete (e.g., delivery created but invoice not done).

  4. After PGI, stock reduces in the system (e.g., from 10,000 ‚Üí 5,000). However, when we check physical stock, it shows a mismatch (e.g., 6,000 physically available).

  5. This causes stock visibility and accountability issues for the supply chain team.

Requirement:
Instead of Sales doing PGI, we want to shift PGI responsibility to the Supply Chain team. This way, stock movement is fully controlled and monitored by them, avoiding mismatches and conflicts.

My question:

  • Is there a way in S/4HANA Public Cloud to restrict PGI so that only the Supply Chain team can execute it (not Sales)?

  • If yes, what‚Äôs the best practice or standard way to achieve this?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: Certifications not visible on " my certifications " on learning.sap
entry.content:
My valid certifications are not visible under " my certifications" on learning.sap. I checked some similar existing queries and also raised a query with support. They have verified that my universal id is correctly set up and also the email attached to my profile is correct and they are able to see that I have certifications. 

But they also said that "my certifications" tab is experiencing some technical issue so it is not visible on my end. And then they closed the ticket. Can someone please let me know if they are also facing similar issues. It has been quite a few days I am not able to see the certifications and also I don't understand, if I cant access it how can I renew it?

Appreciate any feedback and response

Thanks

entry.title: BAdI/User Exit for Billing Document Creation (VF01 ‚Äì Type RE) to Trigger Workflow
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a requirement where a workflow approval process needs to be triggered whenever a Billing Document of type RE is created using transaction VF01.

üîπRequirement:

  • When a billing document of type RE is created and saved in VF01,

  • A workflow event should be raised so that the document goes for approval before completion.

üîπMy Question:

  • Which BAdI or User Exit is best suited to capture the save of a billing document in VF01 for this purpose?

  • The requirement is to identify the correct enhancement point where I can place logic to trigger the workflow event.

Any guidance or best practice recommendation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Kiran Kumar

entry.title: system change the plant address automatically in a customer address
entry.content:
Hello all,

I have this phenomenon in our SAP S4 HANA system (no retail):


The system change the plant address automatically in a customer address. This came after one year of go-live. One year the plant was correct - without automatically changes. 


If we correct the plant address via OX10 and transport it to our production system, the plant address will be automatically overwritten (every two/three weeks) from transaction VL09 or VL02N (we saw it on the database).
But we don¬¥t find the reason why the system change it automatically. Important to know, this is a trade process. 

Its only for 2 plants - not for all plants. We checked batch jobs, customer-programms, check user behavior and so on.
No solution to find the bug. We also can¬¥t reproduce the error.


Actual we check BAPI_ADDRESSORG_SAVEREPLICA.

Do you have any ideas what is ?


Thanks and best regards,
Sandra

entry.title: Fiori VA01 WebGUI ‚Äì Quantity field input lost when entering material and quantity quickly
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we recently went live with S/4HANA and are using the VA01 transaction via WebGUI, exposed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad.

We are experiencing a usability issue during fast order entry in the item section of VA01:

  • The sales colleague enters a material number, presses Enter, and immediately types the quantity (e.g., "100").

  • The problem is: only "00" appears in the quantity field ‚Äî the first digit is lost.

  • This seems to be caused by the asynchronous loading of material master data, which overwrites the manually typed quantity.

This issue did not exist in ECC with classic SAP GUI, where fast blind typing worked fine. Our sales team needs to work quickly, entering multiple line items during customer calls, and this behavior is significantly slowing them down.

SAP support has confirmed the behavior but unfortunately stated that no correction is currently planned.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue or found a workaround?
Any suggestions (e.g. technical workaround, enhancement option, or front-end trick) would be highly appreciated!

‚ÄÉ

 

Best regards,

ChG

entry.title: Network Assignment on VBEP-AUFNR gets deleted due to Credit Block (FSCM)
entry.content:
Dear All, 

We have implemented FSCM Credit Management on ECC and face the issue that when a Sales Order goes on a credit block, no Network Plan gets created. In addition, we have the issue when a network plan was assigned to the sales order and the credit check is executed and failed (e.g., due to not enough credit limit), the existing network plan assignment (VBEP-AUFNR) gets deleted. 

We thought that this had something to do with the confirmed quantities, but were not able to confirm this assumption so far. 

Does somebody have an idea what could be checked?  Or does somebody know the behaviour that the AUFNR gets deleted due to a credit block?

Thank you very much for your support!

entry.title: Need Help
entry.content:
The client requires a report of the actual weights provided by the warehouse after the goods have been packed and the entire pallet has been weighed. The macro adjusts the discrepancies between the actual weight and the SAP weight by proportionally adding or subtracting kilograms from the SAP weight for each line item on the given pallet. This adjustment is made proportionally for each reference on the pallet.
For below example, if the actual weight is 10 kg less than the SAP weight, the macro will subtract 8 kg proportionally from reference PN A and 2 kg from PN B.
We are unable to set the actual weight directly in SAP because there are deviations in the weight of individual references. The client does not accept these deviations and wants the actual pallet weight to be reflected accurately. Therefore, we need to adjust the weight per reference so that the totals sum up correctly.
The macro adjusts the weights proportionally across all products on a given pallet based on the difference between the actual measured weight and the SAP weight.
It then recalculates the quantities into pieces (gross/net), assuming a tare weight of 25 kg.
 
For example, if a pallet weighs 510 kg in SAP but actually weighs 500 kg, and contains:
    PN A ‚Äì 410 kg
    PN B ‚Äì 100 kg
After running the macro, the adjusted weights become:
    PN A ‚Äì 402 kg
    PN B ‚Äì 98 kg
How can we implement this so we can see actual weight on invoices????

entry.title: Is this App 'Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction App ID: F4920' Instruction file
entry.content:

But this takes us to only Solution scenarios for cloud. on which the instructions file cant be downloaded. Process Navigator - SAP for Me 

 

Can anyone provide the instructions to setup the communication scenarios for S/4HANA on-premise.

 

Thanks,

Neha

entry.title: How to trace the service confirmation document and its accounting impact in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
We are currently implementing the Sales module in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for a service company. The customer only works with service materials.

The sales process is as follows:

  • Sales Contract (quantity-based)

  • Sales Order

  • Preliminary Billing Document (Proforma)

  • Invoice

The customer does not work with billing plans.

The requirement is to trigger provisional revenue recognition when the Preliminary Billing Document (Proforma) is created, and then reverse this entry once the final invoice is posted. We are aware that the Proforma does not generate accounting postings, so most likely we will need to build something in SAP BTP.

 We are testing a scenario where we create a ‚Äúphantom goods issue‚Äù because revenue recognition is usually triggered at the goods issue confirmation.

  • We are using a non-stock material.

  • The sales order item category is TAX (non-stock).

  • Then we create and post an outbound delivery.

  • As a result, the system generates an Outbound Delivery Document and a Service Confirmation Document.

The issue:
We cannot find any way to track or display this Service Confirmation Document in the system. We would like to know:

  1. Does this Service Confirmation Document generate any accounting postings in Public Cloud?

  2. Where can this document be viewed or traced in the available Fiori apps?

Has anyone faced a similar requirement or can point us in the right direction?

Thanks in advance for your support! 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales SD (Sales and Distribution) SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
